column2: Gluten-free bread, Avocado, Salt, Pepper, Red pepper flakes, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil
column3: 1. Toast gluten-free bread until golden brown.
column4: 2. Mash avocado and spread it evenly on the toast.
column5: 3. Sprinkle with salt pepper and red pepper flakes to taste.
column6: 4. Optionally top with sliced cherry tomatoes and a drizzle of olive oil.

column2: Coconut yogurt (keto-friendly), Granola (keto-friendly, nut-free), Mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Stevia or erythritol (keto-friendly sweetener)
column3: 1. In a bowl or glass layer coconut yogurt and keto-friendly granola.
column4: 2. Add a layer of mixed berries.
column5: 3. Repeat layers until the container is filled.
column6: 4. Sweeten with stevia or erythritol if desired.

column2: Almond flour, Coconut milk (keto-friendly), Berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Chia seeds, Stevia or erythritol (keto-friendly sweetener), Vanilla extract
column3: 1. In a saucepan heat coconut milk over medium heat.
column4: 2. Stir in almond flour chia seeds and vanilla extract until thickened.
column5: 3. Once thickened remove from heat and top with mixed berries.
column6: 4. Sweeten with stevia or erythritol if desired.

column2: Frozen mixed berries, Avocado, Spinach, Coconut milk (keto-friendly), Chia seeds, Stevia or erythritol (keto-friendly sweetener)
column3: 1. In a blender combine frozen mixed berries avocado spinach coconut milk and chia seeds.
column5: 3. Pour into a bowl and sweeten with stevia or erythritol if desired.

column2: Eggs, Bell peppers, Onion, Spinach, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Cheese (optional)
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced bell peppers onions and spinach to the skillet.
column6: 4. Crack eggs into the skillet and scramble until cooked through.
column7: 5. Season with salt pepper and a sprinkle of cheese if desired.

column2: Quinoa, Mixed vegetables (such as cucumber, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, red onion), Chickpeas, Lemon juice, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as parsley, cilantro)
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
column4: 2. In a large bowl combine cooked quinoa mixed vegetables and chickpeas.
column5: 3. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil and season with salt pepper and fresh herbs.
column6: 4. Toss to combine and serve chilled.

column2: Tomatoes, Vegan mozzarella cheese, Fresh basil, Balsamic vinegar, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Slice tomatoes and vegan mozzarella cheese into rounds.
column4: 2. Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate alternating with fresh basil leaves.
column5: 3. Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and olive oil.
column6: 4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

column2: Lettuce leaves, Hummus, Mixed vegetables (such as cucumber, bell peppers, carrots, avocado), Lemon juice, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Spread a layer of hummus on lettuce leaves.
column5: 3. Drizzle with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper.
column6: 4. Roll up the lettuce leaves tightly.
column7: 5. Slice the wrap in half and serve.

column2: Romaine lettuce, Cucumber, Cherry tomatoes, Red onion, Kalamata olives, Vegan feta cheese, Olive oil, Lemon juice, Dried oregano, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Chop romaine lettuce and cucumber halve cherry tomatoes and thinly slice red onion.
column4: 2. Combine chopped vegetables in a large bowl with kalamata olives and crumbled vegan feta cheese.
column5: 3. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
column6: 4. Sprinkle with dried oregano salt and pepper.
column7: 5. Toss to coat evenly and serve chilled.

column2: Mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snap peas), Tofu, Soy sauce, Garlic, Ginger, Olive oil, Sesame seeds, Green onions
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
column6: 3. Add sliced tofu and cook until lightly browned.
column7: 4. Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
column8: 5. Stir in soy sauce and cook for another minute.
column9: 6. Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions before serving.

column2: Eggplant, Marinara sauce (store-bought or homemade), Ricotta cheese, Parmesan cheese, Garlic, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh basil
column4: 2. Slice eggplant lengthwise into thin strips.
column5: 3. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sauté minced garlic until fragrant.
column6: 4. Spread a thin layer of marinara sauce in the bottom of a baking dish.
column7: 5. Place a spoonful of ricotta cheese on each eggplant slice roll up and place seam side down in the baking dish.
column8: 6. Pour remaining marinara sauce over the eggplant rolls.
column10: 8. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until eggplant is tender.
column11: 9. Garnish with fresh basil before serving.

column2: Eggplant, Marinara sauce (store-bought or homemade), Vegan mozzarella cheese, Nutritional yeast, Italian seasoning, Salt, Pepper, Olive oil
column4: 2. Slice eggplant into rounds and season with salt and pepper.
column5: 3. Dip eggplant slices in beaten egg then coat with a mixture of nutritional yeast and Italian seasoning.
column6: 4. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook breaded eggplant slices until golden brown on both sides.
column7: 5. Spread marinara sauce in the bottom of a baking dish then arrange a layer of cooked eggplant slices on top.
column9: 7. Repeat layers until all eggplant slices are used finishing with a layer of cheese on top.
column10: 8. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly.

column2: Cauliflower rice, Vegetable broth, Mushrooms (such as cremini or shiitake), Onion, Garlic, White wine (optional), Nutritional yeast, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh parsley
column3: 1. In a saucepan heat vegetable broth and keep it warm over low heat.
column4: 2. In a separate large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat.
column5: 3. Add diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until softened.
column6: 4. Add sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until browned and tender.
column7: 5. Stir in cauliflower rice and cook for 1-2 minutes until lightly toasted.
column8: 6. If using add white wine to the skillet and stir until absorbed.
column9: 7. Begin adding warm vegetable broth to the skillet 1/2 cup at a time stirring frequently and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding more.
column10: 8. Continue adding broth and stirring until the cauliflower rice is creamy and tender about 15-20 minutes.
column11: 9. Stir in nutritional yeast for added flavor.
column12: 10. Season with salt and pepper to taste and garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.

column2: Mixed vegetables (such as cauliflower, carrots, bell peppers, peas), Coconut milk, Curry powder, Garlic, Ginger, Onion, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh cilantro, Cauliflower rice (for serving)
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or pot over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced onion minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet and cook until softened and fragrant.
column5: 3. Stir in curry powder and cook for another minute.
column6: 4. Add mixed vegetables to the skillet and stir to coat with the curry mixture.
column7: 5. Pour in coconut milk and bring to a simmer.
column8: 6. Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
column9: 7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
column10: 8. Serve vegetable curry over cauliflower rice and garnish with chopped fresh cilantro.

column2: Bell peppers, Quinoa, Black beans, Corn, Onion, Garlic, Tomato sauce, Chili powder, Cumin, Paprika, Salt, Pepper, Vegan cheese (optional)
column4: 2. Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
column5: 3. In a skillet sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened.
column6: 4. Add cooked quinoa black beans corn tomato sauce chili powder cumin paprika salt and pepper to the skillet. Cook for a few minutes until heated through.
column7: 5. Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds.
column8: 6. Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture.
column9: 7. Place stuffed bell peppers in a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes.
column10: 8. Optionally top with vegan cheese during the last 5 minutes of baking.
